categories.title: Recent Updates and Fixes in ElizaOS

content.text: Fixed key derivation and updated remote attestation.
General fixes and improvements.
Reverted support for VoyageAI embeddings API.
Fixed missing @elizaos/plugin-b2.
Added support for VoyageAI embeddings API.
Added Birdeye plugin.
Added EVM OZ governance plugin.
Fixed Windows path issue in pnpm build client.
Added character creation template function to start.sh.
Fixed minor typos in README.md and CHANGELOG.md.
Added delete agent functionality to Direct Client API.
Added an example service.
Added weekly contributor meeting notes.
Eliza can now be deployed with Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) and remote attestations on Fleek. Users can get started with the provided documentation.
The Eliza framework is currently integrated with over 20 blockchains, including Ethereum, which was added in November.
ElizaOS v0.1.8 has been launched, with notable growth in its GitHub repository: 11.4k+ stars (+1.2k from last week), 3.2k+ forks (+500 from last week), and 376 contributors (+105 from last week).
Eliza is used in gaming applications and does not rely on a room model, meaning it either requires an orchestrator or follows a turn-based model.
A new plugin, AgentKit, has been added to Eliza, providing EVM support and making it extensible for future tools.
A user has requested documentation on running Eliza locally with multiple NVIDIA GPUs, as they are unsure whether the issue is related to installation or necessary code modifications.
A new plugin has been introduced to support the BNB Chain (BSC and opBNB), allowing users to perform various blockchain operations such as transfers, swaps, staking, and token deployment.
A Rooch plugin has been proposed for Eliza, though details on its functionality and risks are not fully outlined.

categories.title: AI Coordination, Project Updates, and Learning Resources

content.text: As content becomes more abundant, managing information across multiple channels is increasingly difficult. AI agents that assist with scribing and routing information could significantly improve coordination.

Project updates from the WDYGDTW #9 weekly meeting on 10/1 include progress on BetterCallMidas, a safe wallet infrastructure, and growing a waitlist and Discord server. Additionally, Ongo AI shared updates on their project.

Further WDYGDTW #9 updates include the development of the 'Feather' agent framework, a timeline scraper for AI news, and an AI agency. Another project presented a plugin for automated liquidity provisioning on Orca.
A user expresses appreciation for a part of a discussion with @AvaDoesAI.
For those interested in learning how AI works, recommended resources include Andrej Karpathy's 'Neural Networks Zero to Hero' playlist for engineering implementation and additional math resources.
A lighthearted exchange between users regarding AI-related discussions.
A user shares that AI itself is not frightening, but misaligned incentives are a greater concern.
A proposal suggests integrating Gitcoin Passport into AI agents to assess Ethereum address credibility, aiding in decision-making and trust.

The cryptocurrency market has seen fluctuations in the prices of major assets. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) increased from $94,335.26 to $96,293.01. Similarly, Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) rose from $3,135.31 to $3,223.66. Solana (SOL) also experienced an increase, moving from $182.77 to $187.43. The ai16z token saw a notable rise from $1.14 to $1.38.

categories.title: Crypto Community Updates and Builder Recognition

content.text: Shaw has been actively building in crypto since 2021, contributing to projects like @lootproject. Some in the crypto community have shown hostility, but others defend his dedication to open-source development, emphasizing the importance of onboarding new developers.
A congratulatory message was shared, humorously swapping 'Harvard' for 'Stanford' in recognition of an achievement.
Interest was expressed in seeing what @coordinape and @MindCultivate are working on.
The first @daosdotfun experience has been described as life-changing, with a strong commitment to the project.
A call to highlight builders in the crypto space was made, emphasizing their contributions.

@elizawakesup provided an update on community growth, the upcoming 'simp to earn' feature, a 3D front end, and the search for developers and artists during WDYGDTW #9. There is also a suggestion for an automated weekly show for agents to present updates.
Praise was given for the excellent work of several contributors in the crypto space.

categories.title: ElizaOS Updates: Database Enhancements and DAO Proposals

content.text: The latest WDYGDTW #9 weekly meeting on 10/1 covered key updates on ElizaOS. @spaceodili discussed improvements to ElizaOS's database and memory systems, while @0xBuildInPublic detailed enhancements to documentation and a DAO proposal for web3 security auditing.

A database update was implemented to optimize memory retrieval across adapters by adding a limit parameter. This change ensures that only a specified number of memories are retrieved, preventing excessive data fetching. The update applies to SQLite, SQLjs, PGLite, and Supabase adapters, with consistent DESC ordering across all queries.

A new feature was introduced to ElizaOS's database adapters, adding a `getMemoriesByIds` method. This enables batch memory retrieval across multiple database adapters, including pglite, postgres, sqlite, sqljs, and supabase. The update improves efficiency by allowing multiple memories to be fetched in a single query. Testing was conducted with various scenarios, including invalid table names, empty memory ID arrays, and large batch retrievals.

During the WDYGDTW #9 weekly meeting on 10/1, @vargs_g shared updates from @0g_labs, including the Zero-G storage plugin, a new NFT standard for verifiable data ownership, and a decentralized serving framework.

A new feature has been introduced to enhance NFT market intelligence and social media integration. This includes two automated tweet actions: one for publishing daily NFT buying opportunities and another for showcasing curated NFT collections with market stats. The system incorporates intelligent opportunity detection, engaging tweet formats, and robust error handling.

Enhancements to the NFT collections plugin have been implemented, including advanced thin floor detection, improved data handling, and experimental tastemaker features. The update also introduces daily NFT opportunity tweets and curated collection insights while fixing issues with incorrect floor prices from the Reservoir API.

A new Agent NFT feature has been developed, following the ERC-7857 standard. This allows for agent data storage on 0G storage, NFT-based ownership management, and agent transfer, cloning, and authorization. The implementation includes an AgentNFTClient, NFT generation, and NFT-based agent startup capabilities.

categories.title: Bug Fixes and Improvements in ElizaOS

content.text: A bug was identified where chat input sends multiple messages when using an Input Method Editor (IME) for languages like Chinese, Japanese, or Korean. Pressing Enter while composing text sometimes results in duplicate messages being sent. The expected behavior is that the message should only be sent once.

A fix was implemented to remove unnecessary numbered list formatting from generated tweets. The update introduces regex patterns to clean tweet content by removing numbered list markers and trailing numbers or periods, resulting in more natural-looking tweets.

A bug in the Farcaster client was reported where incoming memories from mentions were using an empty vector instead of embedding the text from the cast. The issue was traced to a hardcoded empty embedding vector in the memory processing code.

A fix was applied to resolve Twitter email authentication failures. The update improves environment variable handling, adds detailed logging for debugging, and maintains all original timing configurations. The fix ensures that Twitter authentication no longer fails due to improper email validation.
A fix was introduced to address issues with Farcaster memory processing. While details are limited, the update likely resolves the previously reported problem of empty embeddings in memory storage.
A user pointed out that someone entered the crypto space around the same time as Shaw.
Shaw responded publicly to a comment but was surprised when private DMs were shared in response.
Shaw criticized a statement, claiming it was entirely incorrect and suggested that the person making the statement had not actually tried the projects they were discussing.

categories.title: ElizaOS Updates: New Plugins and Development Improvements

content.text: ElizaOS has been updated to version 0.1.8, introducing 34 new plugins. Notable additions include blockchain-related plugins such as Akash, which enables deployment management and cloud compute operations, and Arthera, which facilitates interaction with the Arthera blockchain.

Development efforts have focused on package improvements, including missing plugins like @elizaos/plugin-b2, new features such as Gitcoin Passport, and five bug fixes. A total of 34 contributors merged 10 pull requests, with major work involving plugin fixes and optimization of recent interaction queries.

A recent pull request aimed at re-engineering embeddings selection was merged. This update primarily involved fixing and linting existing plugins to ensure the development branch functions correctly. The changes do not require updates to project documentation.
